creditline: Bequest of Dr. John I. Coe
description: abstracted rooftops and skyscrapers in bright colors

inscription:
Titled in pencil in artist\'s hand on back of mount: Small view of New York

Inscribed in pencil in artist\'s hand on back of mount: 2.

Old gallery and exhibition labels on back of mount.
provenance: [Associated American Artists, 1953 (Inventory no. W 3049)]; John I. Coe, Edina, Minn. (1919-2011); Estate of John I. Coe; bequeathed to MIA, 2011.
signed: Signed in blue watercolor, LLC: GROSZ; signed in pencil on back of mount: George Grosz
text: A prominent member of Berlin Dada and the Neue Sachlichkeit (New Objectivity) movements, George Grosz emigrated from Germany with his family in 1933 and settled in New York City, having barely escaped from military authorities of the newly installed Nazi regime who considered him an enemy of the state for his radical anti-fascist activities. Though he continued to incorporate political content in his work during the 1930s, he increasingly focused on landscape and urban views in his new homeland, as seen in this abstracted interpretation of the Manhattan skyline.
title: Small View of New York
